intro: Adonis atrorubens, commonly known as the black-red adonis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, deep red to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are borne on tall, slender stalks and are composed of five petals that curve backward, creating a distinctive appearance. Adonis atrorubens is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy and often toxic plants.
